title: What are the best careers of the future that don't involve technology (or aren't technology-intensive)? - Quora

response.answer_text: If a career is not technology intensive, then it is most likely one of 2 things. The first kind of career involves interpersonal relationships. The second kind of career would be one where you are making or creating handcrafted items.  Examples of the first kind would be attendants, nurses or social workers. The important thing is that the person is taking care of someone else's physical,  mental or emotional needs.  Examples of the second kind would be artists,  musicians, chefs or cabinet makers. The important thing is that the person is creating something unique and hand-crafted.

The illiterate of the 21st century will not be those who cannot read and write, but those who cannot learn, unlearn, and relearn. Alvin TofflerAuthor of "Future Shock" With that said the careers of the future will be divided between soft skills expertise that can not be automated and those those on the leading edge of innovation that have not been automated yet because they are way too ahead and can't be put in a software. However despite the best efforts of the technology players and innovators , technology penetration will never be 100%. There will always be situations where it would either not make economic sense or there will be people who will simply prefer no-tech to low-tech approach.
